page.title: 10School meals.
page.content:
In 1985 a high percentage of all school children partake of 'school dinners' which is a cooked, two course meal costing 67 pence. We decided to carry out a survey to find out if they enjoyed these meals and what would they select as their favourite school lunch, and their least preferred meal, if given a choice of what was usually on offer. This was their verdict: {FAVOURITE }LEAST LIKED {_________ }___________ {FISH FINGERS, }LIVER AND ONIONS, {CHIPS, }SWEDE, {PEAS, }SWEET CORN, {SYRUP SPONGE WITH }SEMOLINA WITH {CUSTARD. }JAM.
These results were obtained from a sample of 35 children, which is 55% of those having a school dinner. The overall vedict was 'EXCELLENT'!
